form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mrs. Moody (for herself, Mr. Ossoff, Mr. Cassidy, and Mr. Warnock) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

form.official-title: To amend the National Housing Act to establish a mortgage insurance program for first responders, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Homes for Every Local Protector, Educator, and Responder Act of 2025 or the HELPER Act of 2025.

section.header: FHA mortgage insurance program for mortgages for first responders
section.text: Section 203 of the National Housing Act (12 U.S.C. 1709) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: FHA mortgage insurance program for mortgages for first responders

subparagraph.text: The term first responder means an individual who is, as attested by the individual—

subclause.text: employed full-time by a law enforcement agency of the Federal Government, a State, a Tribal government, or a unit of general local government; and

in carrying out such full-time employment, sworn to uphold, and make arrests for violations of, Federal, State, county, township, municipal, or Tribal laws, or authorized by law to supervise sentenced criminal offenders or individuals with pending criminal charges;

clause.text: employed full-time as a firefighter, paramedic, or emergency medical technician by a fire department or emergency medical services responder unit of the Federal Government, a State, a Tribal government, or a unit of general local government; or
employed as a full-time teacher by a State-accredited public school or private school that provides direct services to students in grades pre-kindergarten through 12.

subparagraph.text: The term first-time homebuyer has the meaning given the term in section 104 of the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act (42 U.S.C. 12704).
The term State has the meaning given the term in section 201.

The term Tribal government means the recognized governing body of any Indian or Alaska Native tribe, band, nation, pueblo, village, community, component band, or component reservation, individually identified (including parenthetically) in the list published most recently pursuant to section 104 of the Federally Recognized Indian Tribe List Act of 1994 (25 U.S.C. 5131).

paragraph.text: The Secretary may, upon application by a mortgagee, insure any mortgage eligible for insurance under this subsection to an eligible mortgagor and, upon such terms and conditions as the Secretary may prescribe, make commitments for the insurance of such mortgages prior to the date of their execution or disbursement.

clause.text: A mortgage insured under this subsection shall—

subclause.text: be made to an eligible mortgagor;
comply with the requirements established under paragraphs (1) through (7) of subsection (b); and

item.text: purchase or repair a 1-family residence, including a 1-family dwelling unit in a condominium project, to serve as a principal residence of the mortgagor, as attested by the mortgagor; or
purchase a principal residence of the mortgagor, as attested by the mortgagor, which is—

subitem.text: a manufactured home to be permanently affixed to a lot that is owned by the mortgagor and titled as real property; or
a manufactured home and a lot to which the home will be permanently affixed that is titled as real property.

clause.text: Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary in the matter following subsection (b)(2)(B) with respect to first-time homebuyers—

subclause.text: the Secretary may insure any mortgage that involves an original principal obligation (including allowable charges and fees and the premium pursuant to subparagraph (B) of this paragraph) in an amount not to exceed 100 percent of the appraised value of the property involved; and
the mortgagor of a mortgage described in subclause (I) shall not be required to pay any amount, in cash or its equivalent, on account of the property.

clause.text: The Secretary shall establish and collect an insurance premium in connection with mortgages insured under this subsection that is a percentage of the original insured principal obligation of the mortgage amount, which shall be collected at the time and in the manner provided under subsection (c)(2)(A), except that the premiums collected under this subparagraph—

subclause.text: may be in an amount that exceeds 3 percent of the amount of the original insured principal obligation of the mortgage; and

may be adjusted by the Secretary from time to time by increasing or decreasing such percentages as the Secretary considers necessary, based on the performance of mortgages insured under this subsection and market conditions.

clause.text: A mortgage insured under this subsection shall not be subject to a monthly insurance premium, including a premium under subsection (c)(2)(B).

paragraph.text: The mortgagor for a mortgage insured under this subsection shall, at the time the mortgage is executed—

subparagraph.text: have completed a program of housing counseling provided through a housing counseling agency approved by the Secretary;

clause.text: be employed as a first responder;

subclause.text: employed as a first responder for not less than 4 of the 5 years preceding the date on which the mortgagor submitted an application to insure the mortgage under this section; or
released from employment as a first responder due to an occupation-connected disability resulting from such duty or employment;

clause.text: be in good standing as a first responder and not on probation or under investigation for conduct that, if determined to have occurred, is grounds for termination of employment;
in good faith intend to continue as a first responder for not less than 1 year following the date of closing on the mortgage; and
have previously never been the mortgagor under a mortgage insured under this subsection;

subparagraph.text: meet such requirements as the Secretary shall establish to ensure that insurance of the mortgage represents an acceptable risk to the Mutual Mortgage Insurance Fund; and

meet such underwriting requirements as the Secretary shall establish to meet actuarial objectives identified by the Secretary, which may include avoiding a positive subsidy rate or complying with the capital ratio requirement under section 205(f)(2).

paragraph.text: There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out the program under this subsection—

subparagraph.text: $660,000 for fiscal year 2026, to remain available until expended; and
$160,000 for each of fiscal years 2027 through 2032, to remain available until expended.

paragraph.text: The authority to enter into new commitments to insure mortgages under this subsection shall expire on the date that is 5 years after the date on which the Secretary first makes available insurance for mortgages under this subsection.
